snippet: Turkish authorities had questioned nearly two dozen people in connection with the death of Sarai Sierra, who was 33 and lived in the Stapleton neighborhood of Staten Island.
abstract: Turkish authorities question nearly two dozen people in connection with death of Sarai Sierra, American tourist from Staten Island; Sierra disappeared the day she was to end a trip to Istanbul; her body was later found a few miles from where she was staying.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and J. DAVID GOODMAN
byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu reported from Istanbul, and J. David Goodman from New York. Christopher Maag contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Turkish authorities had questioned nearly two dozen people in connection with the death of Sarai Sierra, who was 33 and lived in the Stapleton neighborhood of Staten Island.

headline.seo: Turkish Authorities Seek Killer of Tourist From S.I.
headline.main: Turkish Authorities Seek Killer of Tourist From S.I.
headline.print_headline: Turkish Authorities Seek Killer of Tourist From S.I.
